catList: Oxidative Stress and Gene  Expression in Plants and Mammalian Systems. Systems. Oxidative stress, antioxidants, cell signalling, functioning and regulation of gene expression are the concepts not only confined to animal cells but these processes are also known to be important in bacterial and plant cells. Presently a lot of effort is being put into developing stress resistance in plants with the aim of monitoring known antioxidant enzyme activities. After introducing basic concepts about the role of reactive oxygen species as signalling molecules leading gene expression and the role of defence systems the student will choose a topic to submit and present a term paper related to the field of study.
